sections.title: Technology Words
sections.instructions: Match each technology word to its definition.

pairs.prompt: A small portable computer you can carry around.
Small programs you use on a phone or computer.
Wireless internet connection.
A book you read on an electronic screen.
A bag you carry on your back.
A book or website that explains what words mean.
The flat surface you look at on a computer or phone.
A global network that connects computers worldwide.
A page or group of pages you visit online.
To make a duplicate of text or an image.
To place copied text or an image in a new position.
A container for rubbish; also the recycle bin on a computer.

sections.title: Map & Direction Words
sections.instructions: Match each map or direction word to its meaning.

pairs.prompt: A map that shows countries and their borders.
A map that shows mountains, rivers and land features.
A map that shows roads and buildings in an area.
Shows how distances on a map relate to real distances.
Explains what the symbols and colours on a map mean.
A diagram showing north, south, east and west.
A small picture on a map representing a real thing.
The line between two countries or regions.
The name that tells you what a map is about.
Continuing forward without turning.
On the other side of the road or area.
Right beside something.
In the middle of two things.
From one side to the other.
Following the length of a road or river.
Going by something without stopping.
Entering one side and coming out the other.
A circular junction where roads meet.
A narrow path for walking.
The most important city of a country.
